definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate

sentences.english: And welcome to the Curlicue Restaurant, how are you guys doing?
sentences.chinese: 歡迎來到花飾餐館，你們大家好嗎？

sentences.english: It was prettily engraved with flowers on the back.
sentences.chinese: 此件雕刻精美，背面有花飾圖案。

sentences.english: Antirrhinum majus to create flower jewelry brands.
sentences.chinese: “金魚草”全力打造花飾品知名品牌。

sentences.english: Another option is to use fabric scraps to decorate a garment with curlicues and flowers.
sentences.chinese: 另外的方法是用布碎做成花飾來裝飾服裝。

sentences.english: A fancy twist or curl, such as a flourish made with a pen.
sentences.chinese: 花飾，旋曲一種精緻的彎曲或捲曲，如用鋼筆寫成的。

sentences.english: The steel is hollow part of the framework, using cast iron as a component.
sentences.chinese: 取型鋼爲透空部分框架，用鑄鐵爲花飾構件。

sentences.english: Printed accessories paired with printed wardrobe equal the perfect summer ensemble.
sentences.chinese: 印花飾品與印花衣品是夏日的最佳組合。

sentences.english: We also did research... men did wear flowers in the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 我們也做過相關研究，宋朝時男人們的確佩戴花飾。

sentences.english: I like carpets with arabesque patterns.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡帶有阿拉伯式花飾的地毯。

definition: Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
to polish a text/rhetoric/ornate language/to use florid language to conceal errors/to gloss over
lintel (of a door)/fig. family's social status
